And if dense only applies to the last axis, how can we do a real full connections of elements from all dims like in Cafffe?

You could either flatten your input then apply a Dense layer, or write a custom layer that does the same.

Could you please point me out their difference?

They are meant to be the same. They do have a slightly different API and a different implementation. In code going forward, you should use tf.layers rather than tf.contrib.layers, since tf.layers is guaranteed to be API-stable (as part of the 1.0 API) and to stay there for the long term.

body:
> And if dense only applies to the last axis, how can we do a real full connections of elements from all dims like in Cafffe?

You could either flatten your input then apply a `Dense` layer, or write a custom layer that does the same.

> Could you please point me out their difference?

They are meant to be the same. They do have a slightly different API and a different implementation. In code going forward, you should use `tf.layers` rather than `tf.contrib.layers`, since `tf.layers` is guaranteed to be API-stable (as part of the 1.0 API) and to stay there for the long term.
